discourse_list.title: Collateral Onboarding Call #27: Fortunafi - Wednesday, February 17 18:00 UTC

content.content: Collateral Onboarding Call #27: Fortunafi - Wednesday, February 17 18:00 UTC  1280×720 47.4 KB  Time in your local-timezone format: 2021-02-17T18:00:00Z  Dial In Details Zoom call Passcode: RWA-WG  Intro An open discussion where we discuss projects and potential assets for MCD, open for anyone to join. If you’d like to present, check out this thread.  Agenda  Intro by @juan   Fortunafi - https://www.fortunafi.com/  MIP6: [FFT1-DROP] MIP6 Application: Fortunafi DROP: Revenue Based Financing Assets “Fortunafi is a yield and lending protocol for tokenized real world, cash flowing assets. In traditional capital markets and securitizations, the process from asset creation to a final securitization bond product requires numerous counter-parties that capital market participants must pay to verify information regarding the assets that are being bought, sold, and financed every day. This results in a less efficient and more expensive process. Fortunafi is verticalizing the entire process by bringing significant efficiencies to Asset Originators and better yields to investors by eliminating the various rent seeking capital market participants. This type of yield has historically only been available to the largest institutional investors (Pension Funds, Sovereign Wealth Funds, Private Equity Funds, Hedge Funds, etc). Fortunafi is made possible by the technologies from Centrifuge, Maker, Balancer, and several other Decentralized Finance projects.”  Attn: @amyjung, @juan, @sebventures, @_nick, @hinchliff, @will, @bcd, @psychonaut, @planet_x, @longforwisdom, @jason, @ejbarraza

Thanks for coordinating this! We look very forward to sharing more about Fortunafi and answering any questions. Please see some additional relevant materials to review ahead of the call:  Fortunafi’s Website Corl’s Website MIP6 Underwriting Report on Corl Fortunafi Demo to Centrifuge Community Fortunafi Deck – Centrifuge Community Intro Fortunafi Deck – Maker Community Intro Pool Launch Blog Post Articles:  Revenue Based Financing: The next step for private equity and early-stage investment Recurring Revenue: The Rise of an Asset Class

Collateral Call Summary - Episode #27  February 17th, 2021 Agenda   00:00: Intro with Juan Guillén  02:10: Fortunafi with Nick García and Derek  00:00: Q&A and Discussion about Fortunafi  Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KInQ7nVP9pc Introduction Juan Guillén Agenda and Preamble 00:00  Welcome to another MakerDAO Collateral Call. Today we have another session with real-world assets, or real-world finance. We’ll have Nick from Fortunafi presenting their project. Before we start, I don’t know, Seb, if you want to give some real-world finance updates, maybe an update on MIP21, MIP22 or what’s happening (00:57)  Discussions about collateral happen in the Forum.   Fortunafi  [FFT1-DROP] MIP6 Application: Fortunafi DROP: Revenue Based Financing Assets  Nick García and Derek Presentation 02:10 Fortunafi1920×1080 143 KB Team1920×1080 200 KB Vision1920×1080 148 KB Why RBF Assets?1920×1080 173 KB Revenue Based Financing1920×1080 243 KB Growing Assets Class1920×1080 193 KB CORL1920×1080 224 KB CORL - Underwriting Report1920×1080 241 KB  10:22 — Tadeo: This is essentially a cashflow-based underwriting, right?   10:45 — Greg DiPrisco: How are you custodying these assets? How are you structured?   11:18 — Payton Rose: Worst-case scenario would be that a company you just vetted starts selling next to nothing. That would be the worst-case scenario given that you have the senior debt   12:07 — Juan Guillén: Nick, is CORL one of the companies you’re investing in or is it one of your partners that you use to invest in different projects?  CORL1920×1080 137 KB Account Opening Page1920×1080 206 KB Company Details1920×1080 148 KB Financial Summary1920×1080 152 KB Business Services1920×1080 178 KB Business Owner's Details1920×1080 161 KB Overview1920×1080 176 KB CORL Explorer1920×1080 249 KB Report1920×1080 206 KB Discussion  32:49 — Payton Rose: Regarding the report rundown you’re walking us through, is there a public version, something that anyone can access when you do choose to fund any of these companies? 33:39 — Greg DiPrisco: I have a quick question on the data. I see that you’re pulling from these APIs, but do you ever offer the client the opportunity to input the data themselves? And to what extent do you go through the data and verify that it’s accurate even if it’s pulled from an API? 35:53 — Gred DiPrisco: Do you ensure that the companies are getting regular audits or that their accounting is being done by CPA? 36:30 — Juan Guillén (paraphrasing Planet_x’s question in the chat): Do you have an idea of the volume of these pools and their potential growth? 38:55 — Nick García (repeating a question from Tadeo after a connection issue and then answering it): What is the target client SaaS companies, what size or maturity? 41:45 — Payton Rose: I know that the community greenlight poll just went live for Fortunafi drop token. I was wondering if it would be worthwhile to explain what that token is or what it tracks. Is is the basket of the entirety, just a few you’re selecting…? 43:06 — Phil Chang: Derek, would you mind talking through the back-test that you’ve posted on the MIP6?  Closing Comment Juan Guillén Outro 49:34  NIck and Derek, you’ve already mentioned the websites of the projects, but I don’t know if you want to maybe mention them again and where people can find you, if you’re on Twitter, LinkedIn…(49:45) Thank you for coming. Next week we’re going to be speaking with Kain from Synthetix  Credits   @blimpa produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.

Thanks for the great Summary @blimpa! As discussed at the end of the call here are some relevant links: Website - Fortunafi Website - Corl Twitter - Nick Garcia Twitter - Fortunafi Maker Community Greenlight Poll
